verse.name: v1
verse.lines: My Lord has garments so wondrous fine, And myrrh their texture fills; Its fragrance reached to this heart of mine, With joy my being thrills.

verse.name: c
verse.lines: Out of the ivory palaces Into a world of woe, Only His great eternal love Made my Savior go.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: His life had also its sorrows sore, For aloes had a part; And when I think of the cross He bore, My eyes with teardrops start.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: His garments too were in cassia dipped, With healing in a touch; Each time my feet in some sin have slipped, He took me from its clutch.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: In garments glorious He will come, To open wide the door; And I shall enter my heavâ€™nly home, To dwell forevermore.
